article_text: After finishing second in the nation last season, the Cal Poly men’s tennis team is a strong favorite to take the NCAA Division II crown this year. First-year Head Coach Kevin Platt said he feels his team has what it takes to be a national champion. “We have quite a few players who are nationally ranked,” Platt said. In addition to their ranking, the team has veteran players who understand the pressures of playing in a national tournament. While the team is powerful and experienced, the loss of their number one player has made this season a tougher challenge. Neal Berryman, ranked third in the nation last season, is out for the year with a torn rotator cuff.
